alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Dallas; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Pike; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 12:40AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, Pike, northwestern Grant, northwestern Dallas, Garland, southeastern Montgomery and Hot Spring Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1239 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Daisy State Park to near Arkadelphia. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Arkadelphia... Malvern... Murfreesboro... Glenwood... Gurdon... Mountain Pine... Rockport... Amity... Caddo Valley... Tull... Prattsville... Poyen... Perla... Okolona... Daisy... Lonsdale... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central, western and southwestern Arkansas.
